com.pump.job

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.job.Job
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JobRunnable

    public abstract class Job
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Cancellable
    This is an abstract task usually intended to be delegated to a JobManager.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a very short user-friendly description of this job. The description generally should not change, but the note should. This may be an empty string if no description is available.
        See Also:
        setDescription(String), getNote()

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String s)
        Assign a very short user-friendly description of this job. The description generally should not change, but the note should. This may be an empty string if no description is available, but it may not be null.
        See Also:
        getDescription(), setNote(String)

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String s)
        Assign the name of this Job. This should be a short identifier (even shorting than the description).

      • getReplacementId

        public java.lang.String getReplacementId()
        If this is non-null, then the JobManager should immediately replace all jobs with the same replacement-id.

        For example, if a job is initiated every time the user adjusts a JSlider and those jobs have the id "recalculate", then instead of queuing of queuing 500 jobs only one job will be enqueued. The JobManager may (at its discretion) also try to cancel an active job if its replacement id matches an incoming job's replacement id.

        Returns:
        an identifying String, or null if this attribute isn't used.

      • runJob

        protected abstract void runJob()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is responsible for doing the real work in this Job. This method should constantly poll isCancelled(): if this job has been cancelled, this method should return immediately or throw a UserCancelledException.

        Subclasses are also encouraged to call setDescription() when during this method to give the user cues about what is happening.

        This method is not responsible for interacting with the finish property: that flag will be changed (and listeners notified) when this method returns.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • run

        public final void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setDependencies

        public void setDependencies(java.util.List<? extends Job> list)
        Define a list of other Jobs this Job is dependent on. This Job should not be executed until all of these jobs are finished.

      • setDependencies

        public void setDependencies(Job... array)
        Define a list of other Jobs this Job is dependent on. This Job should not be executed until all of these jobs are finished.
